meanings.definition: To exist or continue in existence
meanings.sent1: The small business was subsisting on local customers for survival.
meanings.sent2: The old traditions are subsisting in the modern world.
meanings.sent3: The plant was subsisting happily in its sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: Hope was the only thing subsisting in the darkest of times.
meanings.sent5: The memories of her childhood were subsisting vividly in her mind.

meanings.definition: To remain alive or in force
meanings.sent1: The endangered species is subsisting in a protected habitat.
meanings.sent2: Despite the challenges, their friendship is subsisting strongly.
meanings.sent3: The old car was subsisting on sheer determination to keep running.
meanings.sent4: His dream of becoming an astronaut was subsisting against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were subsisting as a reminder of a bygone era.

meanings.sent1: The ecosystem is subsisting due to the delicate balance of nature.
meanings.sent2: Her energy levels were subsisting on a healthy diet and regular exercise.
meanings.sent3: The old building was subsisting thanks to regular maintenance work.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was subsisting through constant communication and support.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creativity was subsisting on inspiration from everyday life.
